availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: The Agricultural Deposit Bank was formed in 1856, on Jordan's Row (Upper Street between Main and Short Streets) in Lexington, KY. The original directors were John G. James (President), George W. Brand, John Norton, Oliver Farra, L. H. Chrisman, Dudley Portwood, Benjamin Tyler, James H. Hanna, Jesse Baker, Robert Young, Jordan Scott, Leslie Combs, William Simpson, Edwards Crosby, Silas P. Kenney (see Profiles), J. G. Kinnaird, A. Brand, Willa Viley and Sanders D. Bruce. Operated until about the end of the Civil War.

bibl.p: "Agricultural Deposit Bank of Lexington (1856-1865)*, Lexington History Museum website, (accessed 4 Aug 2017).
